request-380.tweet: actually it's kinda interesting, in the show, the count begging Rosina for forgiveness is the climactic centerpiece and leads to one of the most cathartic emotional resolutions in all the performing arts -- and it takes up only a few measures in the score. Meanwhile at the end of act two we get several minutes of his bullshitting her in this manner. It sort of makes it clear that it wasn't the act of asking for forgiveness in itself that was transcendent, it was doing so while MEANING it

request-382.tweet: i had originally intended that the Count go back to his original voice only at the end of the story but I found out that punting him up to tenor range at that point actually majorly screws up the chord structure of those final few minutes of the opera so I had to walk that back. But then I realized that if I wasn't reserving his original voice for the very end that opened up so many opportunities for villainous personal expression

request-383.tweet: since they both are glasses characters I wanted to take particular care to distinguish Almaviva's villain expression set from Doc Bart's. my sort of guiding idea is that while Doc Bart is quick to anger, anger is a cozy place for him; his anger is very  controlled; Almaviva's anger is wildly out of control and he hates how it feels, it should look like he's just one push away from bursting into tears

request-1066.tweet: Now up to 13MB of RAM, comfortably exceeding the Mac Portable. Possibly the most RAM a classic Mac has ever seen, even if it's virtual. :p

request-1067.tweet: I'm now drawing with the Macintosh Portable on 9MB for a 24-bit Mac. Moving the SCSI hardware out of the way was easy, finding the assumption of a maximum of 8MB RAM in the MoveHHi system call, OTOH, was a right pain. Perhaps I should have started with the Mac Portable ROM. Ah well.

request-1068.tweet: I'm happy with this: An emulated classic (24-bit 68K) Mac with 5MB of RAM. No original classic Mac had >4MB of RAM as the ROM got in the way (*). I've patched the ROM & System 6 to support a relocated ROM. The main constraint on increasing RAM to e.g. 15MB is now the memory-mapped I/O, which also needs relocation. The eventual goal is a physical large-memory classic Mac.(*) The Mac Portable's ROM location allows up to 9MB of RAM, but it's a bit weird, and I'm going for the full 15+MB.

request-1075.tweet: I think this follower/follows imbalance makes more sense in the context of the distribution of followers and follows:High follower accounts have more followers than high follow accounts have follows, while the small account end is more weighted to follows than having followers.If my sample is at all biased to large, visible accounts (which it will be), it'll quickly skew high on followers and low on follows.

request-1076.tweet: Despite local follow fraction being clearly related to the instance's target audience, I'm still interested in any correlation between instance size (‚àù the fraction of the Fediverse they represent), so I plotted follow fraction against weekly instance logins.The fit's poor, but we can see interesting outliers - it turns out that mastodon.social has a *low* fraction of local follows considering its size! As mentioned previously, non-English instances have high local follow counts.
